auth¶

Auth* related model.

This is where the models used by repoze.who and repoze.what are defined.

class spam.model.auth.User(user_name, display_name=None, email=None)¶

User definition.

This is the user definition used by repoze.who, which requires at least the user_name column.

created¶

Public-facing descriptor, placed in the mapped class dictionary.

display_name¶

Public-facing descriptor, placed in the mapped class dictionary.

email_address¶

Public-facing descriptor, placed in the mapped class dictionary.

password¶

A combination of InsturmentedAttribute and a regular descriptor.

permissions¶

Return a set of strings for the permissions granted.

user_id¶

Public-facing descriptor, placed in the mapped class dictionary.

user_name¶

Public-facing descriptor, placed in the mapped class dictionary.

validate_password(password)¶

Check the password against existing credentials.

Parameters:password (unicode object.) – the password that was provided by the user to try and authenticate. This is the clear text version that we will need to match against the hashed one in the database.
Returns:Whether the password is valid.
Return type:bool
class spam.model.auth.Group(group_name, display_name)¶

Group definition for repoze.what.

Only the group_name column is required by repoze.what.

class spam.model.auth.Permission(permission_name, description)¶

Permission definition for repoze.what.

Only the permission_name column is required by repoze.what.
